text: The High King of the Bjornlings sets his sight on the realms of men, not for war - but for commerce.
Forged in the harsh crucible of the Norse lands, Ulfric's resilience grants him enhanced defense, making him a stalwart bulwark against the onslaught of foes.
Known for his diplomatic finesse, Ulfric's interactions with other factions yield improved relations, making alliances and trade agreements more attainable.
As the Frostbound Leader, Ulfric inspires his troops with unyielding determination. Under his command, the Bjornlings fight with enhanced morale and fervor.
Ulfric channels the power of the storm, unleashing a mighty roar that instills fear in his enemies. Those who stand before him falter in the face of the coming tempest.
Harnessing the primal rage within, Ulfric unleashes Bjorn's Fury, a devastating melee attack that sends shockwaves through the ranks of his enemies.
The Boreal Wrath of Ulfric summons the bitter chill of the northern winds, freezing foes in their tracks and leaving them vulnerable to the wrath of the Bjornlings.
Ulfric's deep connection to the Bjornling heritage grants him the ability to recruit specialized units unique to his tribe, instilling a sense of cultural pride in his forces
High King Ulfric leaves a lasting legacy, enhancing the growth and development of settlements under his rule. His people prosper and flourish in the shadow of Bjorn's Legacy.
Aranessa must have gotten her battle prowess from her mother's side..

In the hands of King Ulfric Grondal, the Bjornheart Waraxe stands as a testament to the Bjornling tribe's unyielding spirit. Unlike many Norscan tribes, the Bjornlings favor the old Norse traditions over the chaos-tainted path. The mighty greataxe, forged in the heart of their frost-kissed lands, channels the raw power of the storm-laden winds that sweep across their domain. With each swing, King Ulfric wields the Stormrend Greataxe, cleaving through foes with the primal might that echoes the thunderous legacy of the Bjornling tribe, a beacon of Norse strength in the midst of the chaotic tempest
The enigmatic High King of the Bjornling does not embrace chaos, but rather seeks the ways of Dazh, Olric and Tor.
First mate of the Swordfysh and first lieutenant of Aranessa, Ogg is both a fierce sailor and warrior.
The Waraxe forged by Hafskael is the pinnacle of Skjold's might as proud bastion of the Bjornling.

High King Ulfric Grondal stands as the formidable ruler of the Bjornling tribe, a figure both feared and respected among his people. Unlike many Norscan chieftains, Ulfric embodies the essence of a traditional monarch, commanding authority from his seat in the mighty Skjold. Towering above his warriors, Ulfric is a mighty warrior himself, his presence commanding respect and obedience
A mammoth so large it hardly fits through Skjold's gates, a true sight to be hold and devastating on the battlefield.
A mammoth so large it hardly fits through Skjold's gates, a true sight to be hold and devastating on the battlefield.

Fit for a ruler who bridges the realms of men and Bjornlings, the Crown of Skjold bears imperial grace. Adorned with engraved jewels, this regal artifact exudes authority. Yet, beneath its refined exterior lies a formidable power — the wearer commands unwavering loyalty from all Bjornling tribes, a testament to the unity forged in the icy crucible of Skjold's unforgiving lands.
You know what they say, the first shall be the last..
The High King of the Eldagrimm Gulf and ruler of the Bjornling invigorates his tribal warriors to push beyond the limits of the flesh.
Ability: "Bragnir's Raiders" for Huscarl & Marauder Champion units
All Bjornling Warriors aspiring to rise to the rank of Huskarl are tasked with a pilgrimage to the Isle of Bragnir, where chieftains lay burried and monsters roam freely.
As close to a traditional King a Norscan ruler can get, the King of the Bjornling tribe is as much warrior as he is a diplomat. Engaging in mundane matters and murderous campaigns all the same.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Influence the Kislevite civil war by sending Norscan Raiding parties to plunder Kislev territories
The fate of Kislev is linked in many minds to the fortunes and favour of the great Bear God, Ursun.
The god of thunder and lightning, Tor is worshipped as a warrior god, cleaving the sky to create thunderbolts.
The goddess of healing and comfort, Salyak teaches common sense and sound care, but will not save those whose time has come.
The god of fire and the sun, it was Dazh who took the secret of flame from the sun and gave it to the ancient warrior chiefs

Embrace the winds of fate, for the Bjornlings, renowned sailors and explorers of the northern seas, hold sway over more than just the tempests of the ocean. As the realms of men tremble in the throes of civil discord, you stand poised at the helm of destiny. The great divide between the Orthodox faithful and the Ice Court in Kislev offers a stage for your grand machinations.\\n\\n By unleashing the fury of Norscan raiding parties upon the lands of your choosing, you sow the seeds of chaos and discord, tipping the scales of power in favor of your favored faction. Yet, amidst the turmoil, a greater prize awaits – the favor of the Kislevite gods themselves. Gather the devotion of your raids and beckon forth the blessings of these ancient deities to shape the very course of history. Will you champion the devout Orthodoxy or stand alongside the defiant Ice Court? The choice is yours, and the fate of Kislev hangs in the balance.
On the ragged shores and frozen cliffs the warriors of the Bjornling stand immoveable and steadfast, eager to welcome any daring foe.
Elite household troops of the Norscan Jarls and High Kings. Comprised of the finest warriors the Eldagrimm region has to offer. Well-equipped by their masters and fiercely loyal fighters.
The elite household troops of the Norscan Jarls and High Kings. Their ranks are comprised of the finest warriors the Eldagrimm region has to offer.
The personal guard of the High King, they occupy Skjold's Great Hall. Each member of their ranks has surpassed insufferable challenges on the cliffs of Horvenghaast.
[[col:red]]This Regiment of Renown will unlock only if you ally or Confederate the Bjornling Tribe or have Ulfric Grondal in your faction[[/col]]
The fiercest of Bjornling warriors flock to Horvenghaast to trade and partake in the famed "Duelling Circles," rooftop fighting rituals sacred to the Gods.
Unit capacity: %+n for Bjornling Huscarl units

Seize control of the Ice Pack Bay region, home to the renowned shipyard of Hafskael. As you storm the shores and conquer the rugged cliffs, you secure access to the master shipwright's expertise, granting your tribe the coveted Huscarl units forged within these hallowed halls.\\n\\n Additionally, claiming this strategic port grants you the ability to construct mighty longships, ensuring your naval dominance in the treacherous northern seas. By securing Ice Pack Bay, you not only bolster your naval power and elite forces but also pave the way for diplomatic overtures with the Empire, particularly Nordland. Control of this vital port signals your tribe's readiness to engage in lucrative trade ventures and collaborative endeavors, laying the foundation for prosperous alliances beyond the tumultuous shores of Norsca.
As twilight falls, Bjornling traders arrive with their catch, eager to exchange fish for goods and tales with allies. Torches flicker, casting shadows on rugged faces as laughter fills the air.
As the longships of Bjornlings slice through the waves, their keen eyes scan the waters, ready to cast their nets and hooks to harvest the bounty of the sea.
The various ways the Bjornling tribe sells their captured fish.
Fish is bartered in trades for currency and diplomatic standings
[[col:yellow]]Fishing stance replaces Full Speed stance whilst at sea, captured fish can be bartered in trades[[/col]]
Bjornlings worship the Gods of men and thus can't pledge full allegiance to a Chaos God
Chance to find ancillaries in hauled up fishing nets: %+n%

This repulsive starfish, bloated with the foul blessings of Nurgle, pulsates with an eerie green glow. Its numerous tentacles, lined with unblinking eyes, seem to draw in the surrounding decay like a vortex of pestilence and despair, corrupting all in its vicinity.

Crafted by the legendary fisherman Erik Losteriksson, this hook was said to be imbued with the spirit of the sea itself. Lost during his fateful voyages, its whereabouts remain a mystery, but tales whisper of its reappearance, beckoning a new master to claim its power.

This skeletal horror of the deep, once a fearsome predator, now drifts endlessly in the cold currents, a haunting reminder of the ocean's mysteries. Legends speak of sailors driven mad by its eerie presence, haunted by visions of the abyss.

This monstrous cephalopod, with eyes like pools of midnight, is said to be a harbinger of storms, its writhing limbs ensnaring vessels unlucky enough to cross its path. Its ink-black embrace heralds doom for those who dare venture too far into the deep.
A putrid, bloated fish writhing with festering sores and oozing with foul ichor. Its presence heralds decay and pestilence, spreading corruption wherever it swims.

Glittering like shards of moonlight upon the sea, this prized fish is a delicacy among Bjornling sailors. Tales are spun of ancient rites and forgotten rituals that are reawakened by the shimmering scales of this revered catch.

Twisted by the filth of Nurgle's touch, this diseased pike exudes an aura of decay. Sailors share tales of unsettling visions and morbid omens that haunt the dreams of those who encounter this putrid creature.

Whispers abound of sailors ensnared by the mesmerizing hues of this bewitched fish. Seafarers tell of haunting melodies and haunting harmonies that echo through the night, luring both friend and foe alike.

Writhing with serpentine grace, this ethereal fish is said to be touched by the ever-changing winds of Tzeentch. Mariners recount tales of shifting currents and swirling eddies that mark the passage of this elusive creature.

Bearing the scars of countless battles, this monstrous crab embodies the savagery of Khorne's warriors. Legends speak of the primal rage and unyielding fury that emanate from the clawed grasp of this fearsome crustacean.

This fearsome shell, adorned with jagged spikes and streaked with blood-red hues, is said to have been blessed by the Blood God himself. Legends tell of warriors who wielded such shells as shields, their enemies quaking in fear before the unstoppable fury of Khorne's chosen.

Shrouded in mystery, this divine fish is whispered to be a gift from the gods themselves. Legends speak of celestial blessings and divine intervention that accompany those who are favored by the presence of this sacred catch.
A plain fish common to the Sea of Claws, it holds little to no value - nor does it hold any taste. Unless one prefers the taste of salt and bone, that is.

How this floater managed to survive the frozen waters remains a mystery, yet his knowledge over the ways of men might proof valueable, as his servitude is endless after saving him from a certain death.
Bjornling settlements, fortified against the harshest storms and fiercest enemies.
Assembling a formidable flotilla, ready to dominate the seas and conquer distant lands.
Skill honed through countless battles, wielding his weapon with deadly precision.
Harvesting the ocean's abundance, providing sustenance and trade for the tribe.
The echoing call of the Bjornling by their High Kign, summoning warriors to battle.
''Warriors, raise your shields! Hold fast! The Bjornling shall never falter!''

Crafted in Hafskael's Yard, The Kongelyg, Ulfric's Kingship, towers as a Norscan marvel, feared as the scourge of Eldagrimm. Legend tells of its triumph over five Graeling Wolfships, a saga echoing through the Sea of Claws. It sails as a testament to the might of the Bjornling tribe and the prowess of its king, Ulfric Grondal. Its name strikes fear into the hearts of enemies and inspires awe among allies, a symbol of domination on the tumultuous seas.
Few have the strength to break free once the Kraken has them within its horrid, betentacled grasp.
Harald's named his finest warriors as his personal retinue, they are motivated to the core to fight and establish his rule.
Raze||All buildings are destroyed and the settlement is torched. The previous owners will like you a lot less.
See the end of Kislev supporter race by supporting either side
